publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3360 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day 2002-That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Days 2002 initiative taking place in September 2002, co-ordinated by the Scottish Civic Trust, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country's rich built heritage. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding*, Murdo Fraser*

S1M-3360 Mr Brian Monteith: Doors Open Day 2002-That the Parliament welcomes the Doors Open Days 2002 initiative taking place in September 2002, co-ordinated by the Scottish Civic Trust, which gives people the opportunity to visit and explore for a day, free of charge, various buildings across Scotland such as castles, stately homes and law courts, many of which are not normally open to the public, and believes the initiative gives people the opportunity to improve their understanding of their local architectural environment and the country's rich built heritage. Supported by: Mr Keith Harding, Murdo Fraser
S1M-3360 Doors Open Day 2002 (lodged on 5 September 2002) Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3360 Doors Open Day 2002 (lodged on 5 September 2002) David Mundell*
S1M-3360 Doors Open Day 2002 (lodged on 5 September 2002) Nora Radcliffe*, Tommy Sheridan*
